title: Police: 3-year-old accidentally shot himself in hand
content:
NASHVILLE, TN (WSMV) -
A 3-year-old boy is recovering at the hospital after accidentally shooting himself in the wrist Tuesday evening.
Police said the shooting happened around 6 p.m. at the Glastonbury Woods Apartments.
Officers were flagged down by the child's father, 24-year-old Tevin Tyson, on Briley Parkway near the I-24 interchange.
Treyvon Tyson was then taken by ambulance to Vanderbilt University Medical Center with non-life-threatening injuries.
Tyson told detectives that his son accidentally shot himself in the wrist after getting a .40 caliber semi-automatic pistol out his father's backpack.
Officials said Tyson is a licensed security guard with a handgun carry permit.
Tyson said he and Treyvon put their backpacks on the floor of their apartment when they came home Tuesday evening. He said he asked the 3-year-old to get some clothes out of his own backpack. Tyson said he turned away, then heard a gunshot.
Tyson tried taking his son to the hospital but decided to ask for help when he saw a police officer on Briley Parkway.
Treyvon was expected to be released from the hospital on Tuesday night.
Youth Services is investigating the incident with assistance from Hermitage and South Precinct detectives.
